content:
{"name": "Project DOROT", "alternate_name": "", "description": "- The Kosher Meals at Home program delivers meals to senior adults who keep kosher (or Halal) and live on the **Upper West Side** (from 50th Street to 125th Street) and the **Upper East Side** (from 50th Street to 96th Street). 

- Meals are frozen and come in a “TV Dinner” style tray with a protein, a starch, and a vegetable. Three to five meals are delivered each week (older adults are assigned a delivery day and window of time to expect the delivery). There is a sliding-scale contribution of **$5/meal** down to **$1/meal**.

- There may be a wait list for this program (it changes week-to-week), but in an emergency situation, Kosher Meals at Home can usually assist with meals short-term until a case management agency can take over the meal delivery. 

- The older adult requesting meals needs to be able to safely heat the meals in a microwave or regular oven on their own (or have an aide or family member/caregiver who can heat the meals for them). Meals cannot be heated in a toaster oven unless they are transferred to another dish that is safe.   ", "email": "", "url": "https://www.dorotusa.org/our-programs/at-home/kosher-meals-at-home", "status": "active", "address": {"address_1": "171 West 85th Street", "address_2": null, "city": "New York", "state_province": "NY", "postal_code": "10024", "country": "US"}, "location": {"latitude": 40.7870587, "longitude": -73.97502539999999}, "phones": [{"number": "(212) 769-2850", "type": "voice"}], "regular_schedule": [{"weekday": "Monday", "opens_at": "14:00", "closes_at": "21:00"}, {"weekday": "Tuesday", "opens_at": "14:00", "closes_at": "21:00"}, {"weekday": "Wednesday", "opens_at": "14:00", "closes_at": "21:00"}, {"weekday": "Thursday", "opens_at": "14:00", "closes_at": "21:00"}, {"weekday": "Friday", "opens_at": "14:00", "closes_at": "21:00"}], "service_attributes": [{"attribute_key": "REQUIREMENT", "attribute_value": "Call in advance for services"}]}
